summary: The Forest Bioeconomy Act focuses on expanding research and development related to the use of forest products, particularly in the context of the bioeconomy. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture to expand research on forest products, establish an Office of Technology Transfer within the Forest Service to commercialize technologies, and create a mass timber science and education program to support architects, developers, and the forest products industry. The bill also includes a small business voucher pilot program and establishes a stakeholder advisory group.
